src:
MU Belum Kunjung Stabil, Solskjaer: Kami Masih Terus Berkembang!
07 Nov 2019, 16:40 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Manajer Manchester United, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer kembali meminta para fans Setan Merah bersabar dengan naik-turunnya performa timnya musim ini. Solskjaer percaya bahwa timnya masih berada dalam proses perkembangan sehingga butuh waktu sebelum timnya tampil dengan optimal.
Musim ini Manchester United menjalani salah satu start terburuk dalam sejarah mereka. Mereka hanya mampu memenangkan dua dari sembilan pertandingan perdana mereka di EPL sehingga mereka nyaris masuk ke zona degradasi.
Belakangan ini, United mulai membangun momentum positif dengan meraih tiga kemenangan beruntun. Namun sayang tren itu kembali terhenti setelah mereka dikalahkan oleh Bournemouth dengan skor 1-0 Minggu lalu.
Solskjaer menyebut timnya kecewa tren positif mereka kembali terhenti. "Tentu saja kami kecewa ketika kami menderita kekalahan dan tentu saja kami masih belum menunjukkan kemampuan terbaik kami," beber Solskjaer kepada MUTV.

Baca komentar lengkap sang pelatih di bawah ini.
text:
MU Has Not Been Stable, Solskjaer: We Still Continue To Grow!
Nov 7 2019, 16:40 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has again asked Red Devils fans to be patient with the ups and downs of his team's performance this season. Solskjaer believes that his team is still in the process of development so it takes time before his team performs optimally.
This season Manchester United underwent one of the worst starts in their history. They were only able to win two of their first nine matches in the EPL so they almost went into the relegation zone.
Lately, United began to build positive momentum by winning three consecutive wins. But unfortunately the trend stopped again after they were beaten by Bournemouth 1-0 last Sunday.
Solskjaer called his team disappointed their positive trend came to a halt. "Of course we are disappointed when we suffer defeat and of course we still have not shown our best ability," beber Solskjaer told MUTV.

Read the trainer's full comment below.
